definitions: legal right to occupy property for a specific period under terms of a lease agreement
examples: They purchased the leasehold for their apartment building
The leasehold expires in fifty years from now

definitions: rope or strap attached to collar for controlling and walking pets
examples: Keep your dog on a leash in public areas
She bought a retractable leash for daily walks

definitions: world's largest turtle species with soft leathery shell instead of hard plates
examples: The leatherback can dive deeper than any other turtle
Scientists tracked the leatherback across the Pacific Ocean

definitions: action of going away from a place or person
things that remain after others have been removed
examples: His sudden leaving surprised everyone at the party
The leaving ceremony was emotional for graduating students
The leavings on the plate went into the compost
We collected the leavings from the harvest field

definitions: tall stand with slanted top for holding books or papers while speaking
examples: The speaker approached the lectern to begin her presentation
He adjusted the microphone attached to the wooden lectern

definitions: person who gives educational talks at colleges or universities below professor rank
examples: The lecturer explained quantum physics to undergraduate students
She worked as a lecturer before becoming a professor

definitions: university post or appointment involving teaching duties and giving educational presentations to students
examples: She accepted a lectureship at the local university
The lectureship includes both teaching and research responsibilities

definitions: act of giving formal talks to teach or instruct groups of students
examples: His lecturing style kept students engaged throughout class
She spent twenty years lecturing on medieval history

definitions: projecting ridge on wall or cliff face providing narrow surface or foothold
examples: Birds nested on the rocky ledge halfway up
She placed flower pots on the window ledge

definitions: book for recording business transactions and accounts in systematic organized format
examples: The accountant updated entries in the company ledger
They discovered errors when reviewing the old ledger

definitions: side away from wind providing protection from weather elements
examples: Ships anchored in the lee of the island
We pitched our tent in the lee of the hill

definitions: aquatic worm that attaches to animals and feeds on blood
person who takes advantage of others without giving anything back
examples: Doctors once used leeches for medical bloodletting treatments
The hikers found leeches attached after wading through swamp
He was a leech who borrowed money without repaying
Don't be a leech on your generous friends

definitions: edible plant related to onion with long cylindrical white bulb and flat green leaves
examples: She added chopped leeks to the potato soup
The garden produced excellent leeks this growing season

definitions: sly or lascivious facial expression showing improper sexual interest
examples: His leer made everyone at the bar uncomfortable
She ignored the leer from the stranger across the room

definitions: side or direction toward which wind is blowing away from windward
examples: The yacht sailed to the leeward side of the island
Smoke drifted leeward from the campfire across the beach

definitions: amount of freedom to move or act within set limits
examples: The deadline gives us some leeway for revisions
Teachers need leeway to adapt lessons for different students

definitions: person who supports liberal or radical political views favoring social equality and reform
examples: The leftist argued for increased social welfare programs
Many leftists protested against the conservative government policies

definitions: food remaining after meal that can be stored and eaten later
examples: We packed the leftovers for tomorrow's lunch meal
The refrigerator was full of leftovers from the party

definitions: informal term for person who uses left hand as dominant hand
examples: The lefty needed special scissors for comfortable cutting
Baseball teams often seek lefty pitchers for strategic advantage

definitions: official process of making something legal that was previously prohibited by law
examples: The legalisation of same-sex marriage occurred in 2015
They debated the legalisation of certain recreational substances

definitions: state or quality of being in accordance with the law
examples: Lawyers questioned the legality of the new regulations
The company verified the legality before proceeding with plans

definitions: official process of making something legal that was previously prohibited by law
examples: The legalization debate continued in the state legislature
Many countries considered marijuana legalization for medical purposes

definitions: Mediterranean breed of chicken known for prolific white egg production
examples: The farm raised white leghorns for commercial eggs
Leghorns are popular backyard chickens for steady egg supply

definitions: quality of being clear enough to read easily
examples: The document's legibility improved with larger font size
Poor handwriting reduced the legibility of her notes significantly

definitions: ancient Roman army unit of three to six thousand soldiers
very large number or multitude of people or things
examples: The Roman legion marched across the conquered territory
Caesar commanded several legions during the Gallic Wars
Her fans were legion across multiple social media platforms
The problems facing the company were legion and complex

definitions: soldier who served in ancient Roman legion military unit
examples: The legionary wore standard armor and carried regulation weapons
Each legionary trained rigorously for combat and construction duties

definitions: member of military legion especially French Foreign Legion or veterans organization
examples: The legionnaire served five years in remote desert outposts
American Legion legionnaires gathered for the annual convention

definitions: act of making or enacting laws through formal governmental process
examples: Congress spent months legislating new healthcare reform measures
The difficulty of legislating complex issues frustrated many lawmakers

definitions: elected or appointed person who makes laws in government legislature
examples: The legislator proposed a bill to improve education funding
State legislators debated the budget during the special session

definitions: quality of being lawful, proper, or justified according to established rules or standards
examples: Critics questioned the legitimacy of the election results
The government's legitimacy depended on popular support from citizens

definitions: act or process of making something legitimate, lawful, or officially acceptable
examples: The legitimation of his claim required extensive legal documentation
Social movements often seek legitimation through peaceful protest methods

definitions: plant with seeds in pods including beans, peas, and lentils rich in protein
examples: Farmers rotate crops with legumes to enrich soil nitrogen
Vegetarians often eat legumes as their primary protein source

definitions: decorative garland or wreath of flowers worn around neck in Hawaiian culture
examples: Visitors received a traditional lei upon arriving in Hawaii
She made a beautiful lei with plumeria and orchid flowers

definitions: time when one is not working and can relax or enjoy activities
examples: She enjoyed reading books during her leisure hours
The resort offered many leisure activities for guests

definitions: recurring musical phrase associated with particular person, idea, or situation in composition
examples: Wagner used leitmotifs throughout his epic opera cycle
The villain's leitmotif played whenever danger approached the hero

definitions: basic form of word used as headword in dictionary or linguistic analysis
examples: The lemma 'run' represents all forms like runs and running
Linguists study how lemmas relate to their inflected forms

definitions: small rodent found in arctic regions known for periodic mass migrations
examples: The lemming population cycles dramatically every few years
Contrary to myth, lemmings don't deliberately jump off cliffs

definitions: sweet beverage made from lemon juice, water, and sugar
examples: Children sold lemonade from their sidewalk stand yesterday
Nothing beats cold lemonade on a hot summer day

definitions: primate native to Madagascar with large eyes, long tail, and pointed snout
examples: The ring-tailed lemur is Madagascar's most recognizable primate species
Lemurs face habitat loss from deforestation on the island

definitions: person or institution that provides money expecting repayment with interest
examples: The mortgage lender approved their home loan application
Banks act as lenders to individuals and businesses

definitions: act of providing money or items temporarily expecting return
examples: The bank's lending practices came under regulatory scrutiny
Library lending of digital books increased during the pandemic

definitions: act or process of making something longer in distance, duration, or extent
examples: The lengthening of daylight hours signals approaching spring
Road construction required lengthening the original bridge design

definitions: quality of being more merciful or tolerant than expected in judgment or punishment
examples: The judge showed leniency due to the defendant's circumstances
Teachers sometimes regret showing too much leniency with deadlines

definitions: small flat round seed of legume plant used in soups and dishes
examples: She prepared hearty lentil soup for the cold evening
Red lentils cook faster than green or brown varieties

definitions: large wild cat with distinctive spotted coat native to Africa and Asia
examples: The leopard stalked its prey through the tall grass
Conservation efforts helped protect endangered snow leopard populations

definitions: person affected by leprosy, historically isolated from society due to contagious fears
examples: Medieval lepers lived in colonies outside town walls
Modern medicine can cure what once made someone a leper

definitions: small mischievous fairy in Irish folklore typically depicted wearing green with hidden gold
examples: Children searched for the leprechaun's pot of gold
The leprechaun has become a symbol of Irish culture
